resources.string: Experience the wide range of watergames and feel like a kid again
This is the biggest Waterpark in Crete.
With a pool bar, Jacuzzi and an artificial small island with wooden toys.
The largest Bronze Age archaeological site on Crete.
A fortress built by the Republic of Venice in the early 16th century.
A citadel that built by the Venetians and captured by the Ottomans in 1646.
The second largest city of Minoan Crete.
An ancient city with highly fortunate geographical situation.
Preparing the directions to go from your current location to the desirable one.
Balos amazes all visitors at first sight with exotic waters and soft white sand.
This place is a heaven on earth, with soft white and pink sand.
Above this, there is the archaeological site of Ancient Falassarna.
Gramvousa refers to two small islands: Iremi and Agria Gramvousa.
This beach is actually where a river flows into the sea.
A relaxing environment with crystal waters and golden sand.
This beach is surrounded by the largest palm tree forest in Europe.
The best museum in the world for Minoan art.
The museum contains a substantial collection of Roman artifacts.
The exhibits present the history of the Prefecture from the Neolithic period.
The museum houses archaeological finds from Lassithi Prefecture.
The museum has received an award by the Historical and Ethnological Society.
The museum operates under the auspices of the University of Crete
